title: \*\* Typography Classes in New York \*\*
content:
Any good classes/courses in NYC? There is never enough typography courses I can take :-)

I've been to SVA and took a class with Ed Benguiat, great attention to detail, and such a fun class!!  
not much about layout, grid etc.

Any schools, teachers, classes anyone in NYC know of?

Thanks for your attention
author: pablink

comments.content:
You should check the TDC website. The club is offering more and more classes geared towards improving designers typographic skills.

[http://tdc.org/events/education/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094449/http:/tdc.org/events/education/index.html "http://tdc.org/events/education/index.html")

More classes for the fall will be forthcoming.
This is great. The walking tour should be awesome!

Cooper Union is offering summer classes in both type and calligraphy. Also, Parsons, SVA, and Pratt offer classes in their professional/continuing education divisions, taught by working professionals.

Or head up to scenic Lake Cayuga, where I will be teaching  
"Stems and Beziers: An Introduction to Typeface Design"  
at the Wells Book Arts Summer Institute, July 9-15.  
Learn more: [http://aurora.wells.edu/~wbac/bookarts/educ\_summerinst.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094449/http:/aurora.wells.edu/~wbac/bookarts/educ_summerinst.html "http://aurora.wells.edu/~wbac/bookarts/educ\_summerinst.html")

Check out the Type@Cooper certificate programs at the Cooper Union:  
 [http://coopertype.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094449/http:/coopertype.org/)

I'm finally back in the US after traveling abroad, and I've signed up for James Montelbano's Type Design course at SVA this fall. I can't wait!

[http://www.sva.edu/continuing-education/graphic-design/typeface-design-1...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094449/http:/www.sva.edu/continuing-education/graphic-design/typeface-design-12-cf-gdc-2153-a "http://www.sva.edu/continuing-education/graphic-design/typeface-design-12-cf-gdc-2153-a")

You're sure to learn quite a bit.

hhp

Typography Summer School ( [http://typographysummerschool.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094449/http:/typographysummerschool.org/ "http://typographysummerschool.org")) which is usually run in London, is expanding to NY this year. They're accepting applications until the 1st of May. (Disclosure: taught by designers that I do some work for.)

This is supposed to be a good intro course: [http://www.nobledesktop.com/graphic-design/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094449/http:/www.nobledesktop.com/graphic-design/ "http://www.nobledesktop.com/graphic-design/")
There are two 3-day introduction workshops in Chicago and Boston in November: [www.craftingtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094449/http:/www.craftingtype.com/ "www.craftingtype.com")
